metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46698 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, iCloud for Windows 14.1, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, watchOS 9.2. Processing maliciously crafted web content may disclose sensitive user information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46698` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
